text: grinds visions hi everyone
Anthony Fantana here internets busiest
music nerd review Grimes visions Grimes
is the montreal-based synthesizer pop
project fronted by singer/songwriter
Claire Boucher this is the third
full-length album from the project and
in a nutshell it's kind of the shorter
and much better produced sequel to the
projects last album Alf AXA and I guess
I say sequel because I feel like Grimes
is going for roughly the same sound on
this LP but there are some notable sonic
improvements but aside from the previous
Grimes record there were a bunch of
other artists that this record reminded
me of as I was listening to it for one
nearly every single one of these tracks
is built on these really quirky
old-school very rigid and rudimentary
synth pop instrumentals that remind me a
lot of artists like OMD Orchestral
Manoeuvres in the dark or Depeche Mode
just just and Claire's voice over these
instrumentals it's really light and
feathery very breathy and high-pitched
in a way it kind of reminds me of a
really artsy goth doubt Madonna the
vocal just really reminds me of
Madonna's first two solo records but the
vocals are sung at a pitch that is sort
of just shy of the pitch that you would
normally hear Vogel sung at on an Alvin
and the Chipmunks record and then the
vocals are just slathered in so much
reverb you can't really make out what
they're saying and they have the
resonance of whale calls now I know that
combination of sounds and influences
sounds kind of weird maybe like a joke
maybe something that you're wincing at
thinking wanna listen
to that stop it but I actually think
it's an interesting idea an interesting
combination of sounds it's really clear
if you listen to Grimes first LP listen
to the second and this one that she's
been slowly developing this style she's
just been chiseling away just perfecting
this aesthetic my issue is that I just
wish the songs on here felt as refined
felt as planned or developed or as
unique a lot of the songs on this thing
just feel really thrown together there
are some tracks on here that don't even
have a chorus you know they just kind of
had this one single idea and then they
end just shy of the two-minute mark as
if there was just no possible way to
progress the song past this one idea as
far as the other tracks go some of their
hooks just sounds so identical to the
verses they might as well be the same
part because it's not really like the
synths or the beat will change all that
much most of the time a lot of these
tracks roughly are pretty much one
instrumental idea with Claire kind of
vocalizing over in a handful of
different ways it's a kind of basic set
up and it's something that I could
definitely see myself getting into if I
felt like I was more in love with the
elements that make these songs up like
the synth work and Claire's voice I
think the vocals on here just feel so
distant I never really get to know them
and at first I was kind of turned off by
the really high pitch that they sing at
but I don't know after a while it just
didn't bug me anymore and I kind of grew
to like it my only real issue with the
vocals on this LP now our spots like the
track vowels equal space and time where
it feels like Claire is kind of singing
out of her range or something really
stressing her voice or just not hitting
the notes that she wants to when she's
essentially soloing with her voice and
as far as the synthesizers go there are
just some bad synth parts on here just
for lack of a better word just some bad
arts it feels like some of these
synthesizer phrases arpeggios melodies
whatever were played by someone who had
just learned music theory like at the
end of the song Genesis where you're
just kind of catching this scale like
been in it in it in any been in it in it
and there are other spots on here like
the arpeggios on be a body or the
synthesizer solos on the track of
Bolivian or night music especially night
music the solos just feel so aimless
they're literally just kind of clumsily
stepping up and down like a scale it
doesn't sound like keyboard playing it
sounds like keyboard practice some of
the beats on this LP are pretty good
though
I do have to give it to Grimes on that
especially with tracks like Genesis and
Oblivion they have this old-school retro
dance-pop feel but they don't feel too
dusty or nostalgic and the track eight
has this really hardcore robotic vocal
sample in the track and these really
hard-hitting rhythms and these high
pitched vocals just swarming all over
the beat I really like how hectic that
song is my only issue is that is just
criminally short the song sir
commandment has a really great groove
too and tracks like color of moonlight
kind of show off this LPS versatility
how Grimes can go from this hard-hitting
catchy dancey pop song to something much
more atmospheric slow and spacious and
still sound pretty decent I'm really not
sure what to make of this LP I feel
extremely on the fence with it it has so
many great ideas and yet there are just
some melodies on here that I don't like
at all some keyboard playing on here
that I think is pretty lazy some songs
just kind of end without doing anything
or developing or going anywhere it's an
album that I guess I thought was pretty
easy to listen to but also pretty easy
to forget kind of feeling a decent two
strong five on this thing but what do
you guys think about it do you love it
do you hate it and let me know why I am
actually
as to what is attracting you guys about
this album sonically musically let me
know Anthony Fantana
Grimes visions forever
